DataElement.preferredName: Neoplasm Other DICER1 Classification Tumor Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of the DICER1 gene which is involved in the RNA interference pathway. Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the systematic arrangement of the DICER1 gene which is involved in the RNA interference pathway. Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant ones exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:This gene is involved in the RNA interference pathway.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
This gene is involved in the RNA interference pathway.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medulloepithelioma arising from the ciliary body of the uvea.

Concepts.definition: A rare, unilateral, malignant embryonal neoplasm typically presenting as a ciliary body mass during childhood. It arises from primitive medullary epithelium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pea-sized endocrine gland located at the base of the brain in the pituitary fossa. It produces and secretes hormones such as oxytocin and vasopressin, to regulate the activities of the hypothalamus.: A malignant neoplasm composed of undifferentiated cells.

Concepts.definition: Pea-sized endocrine gland located at the base of the brain in the pituitary fossa. It produces and secretes hormones such as oxytocin and vasopressin, to regulate the activities of the hypothalamus.
A rare embryonal neoplasm affecting children. It is associated with DICER1 gene mutation. This category includes pituitary gland blastoma and pleuropulmonary blastoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A benign encapsulated neoplasm of the kidney, characterized by the presence of cysts separated by septa. There are no solid areas present. The septa are lined by one layer of epithelial cells that have eosinophilic or clear cytoplasm. The cystic spaces contain serous or hemorrhagic fluid.

Concepts.definition: A localized, well-circumscribed multilocular tumor lined by hobnail epithelium. It was previously classified along with pediatric cystic nephroma, as a separate entity from mixed epithelial and stromal tumors. Now it is classified within the spectrum of the mixed epithelial and stromal tumor family. Most of these tumors are benign. (WHO 2016).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm affecting the lungs and/or the pleura.  Pleuropulmonary blastoma is seen in children.  Microscopically, the tumor may show features of chondrosarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, or undifferentiated sarcoma.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm affecting the lungs and/or the pleura. Pleuropulmonary blastoma is seen in children. Microscopically, the tumor may show features of chondrosarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, or undifferentiated sarcoma. In approximately 25% of patients with pleuropulmonary blastoma, there are other lesions or neoplasms that may affect patients or their families, including lung or kidney cysts, and ovarian or testicular neoplasms. Heterozygous germline mutations in DICER1 gene have been identified in families harboring pleuropulmonary blastomas.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

This gene is involved in the RNA interference pathway.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
